content: I don't know where to start but I found rustc-guide has no contents for MIR optimizations. Should we work on that? (And just a friendly reminder, it's helpful to be added to GitHub team. cc @oli )
yea some rustc-guide info is a good idea
Unfortunately the team thing is out of my hands, I can only add organization members to the team. I'll try to figure out how to do that
Okay, I'll work on that! What should we put there? (where should we refer to?) And about team thing, is there anything I can do for that?
I'm deleting the github team, as we're not using it anyway. Any pinging will be happening on zulip.

we should probably start documenting the optimization pipeline and some info about what kind of optimizations we have (guaranteed and required ones, some that don't optimize, but just check stuff, some that are only turned on in release mode, ...)
Just as a reminder, I opened an issue (https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-guide/issues/331).
It may difficult to come up with suitable content. If there is any document we should refer to, please let me know.
